data.title: Update INSTALL.md for OSX
data.body: The following subset of Linux build directions work for OSX 10.11.3. Mono JIT compiler version 4.2.1

data.title: [RA] Add features to the Engineer.
data.body:
It feels like there's more potential to the Engineer. As of now the unit is more or less discarded after the first minutes of a game. This could also serve as an extended olive branch to players wanting to have the unit used as a production queue killer as it gives the unit a purpose after it has finished capturing oil derrics: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=297153#297153

Allow the Engineer to detect, walk over and disassemble mines: So what if you could a-move the Engineer, triggering it to disassemble mines along its' path, perhaps with a detection range of say, 3?

Allow the Engineer to gradually repair structures: CTRL+Right Click a structure, start repairing. Slowly.

data.title: Helicopters will freeze mid-air if stopped while landing or taking off.

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
This is most easily reproduced by stopping a helicopter (`LandWhenIdle: false`) when it is taking off from or landing on a helipad.

The easy and hacky fix is to make landing and taking off non-cancellable activities.  A better fix should have some understanding of the next step, and choose whether the helicopter should complete its move or undo it before leaving the activity.

data.title: Map tile error on "Desert Twister" map
data.body:
There is a bogus cliff tile at the western entrance to the northern base:

![screen shot 2016-07-31 at 01 19 28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/17273853/64e7324e-56bd-11e6-9ef7-748b97de9f26.png)

data.title: Carryalls and dropships won't land on tiberium or veins.
Fix cancellation of downloads.
data.body:
The Download class cancels asynchronously, which means callers must handle cancellation inside the completion event, and not after requesting cancellation.

Fixes #11739.

When a download is cancelled, the `Cancelled` flag is set, and `Error` contains an exception with a `RequestCanceled` Status. This means if you want to check for either cancellation or an error, simply checking for `Error != null` is sufficient. It also means if you want to handle cancellation differently from an error, you must handle cancellation first.

data.title: Close OpenAL sound device correctly
data.body: Fixes #11193, plus some additional code tiding.

data.title: Chat textbox should be disabled in replays
data.body: It's currently possible to type and send messages, which are then eaten by the game.  Disabling the text field would be an easy polish win.

data.title: Content installer should enumerate over all discs with content.
data.body:
The installer currently shows the installation gui for the first detected disk with new content, then when complete it returns to the main page.  This is awkward for RA after #11545 which requires assets to be installed from both RA and TD that are separate content sources.

The scan should be repeated after the first installation and the next disc should be shown if one is available (filtering the current disc to avoid loops if there's a metadata error).  If these later scans fail it should return to the main page instead of showing the "insert disc" dialog.

data.title: RA movies should be extracted instead of loaded from movies*.mix

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body: This will improve loading times quite a lot for players without SSDs.  We probably want to wait for #11740 before doing this.

data.title: Revert Nuke Truck Damage nerf vs Air
data.body:
#11253 overshot the issue raised by #10865 and #10799 by reducing the guarantee kill zone for YAKs/Hinds from 10 to 3(!). The original issue argued for a slight nerf in order to allow nearby aircrafts get away.

By adding Air as a valid target back to one of the Warheads the guaranteed killzone vs Hinds/YAKs is measured to 6.

data.title: Add 1-click replay downloader-viewer.
data.body: I mean, add tab in game that allows to see every replay, select one, and then, it will automatically download it and start playing.

data.title: Add 1-click replay publishing in game
data.body: Add a button, that allows to upload selected replay in replays window.

data.title: [RA] Increase Mammoth Tank Speed 42->50
data.body:
Discussed and playtested extensively. Pretty straightforward balance change in order to make the Mammoth Tank useful for it's own purposes.

http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=295320#295320

Opinions appear to be unanimous #11077, #10437

data.title: Make certain actors visible in the map preview.
data.body: Trees, ore/gem mines and neutral structures should be visible in the map preview to more accurately describe the map in the lobby.

data.title: Manifest - Recursively include a folder path
data.body:
The ability to include every file and subfolder recursively. In my mod I am working with a single file for each unit and I am using a folder structure to easily maintain and find units. Instead of having a huge YAML for all structures. But the manifest right now is not really great at handling this as I have to make a new entry for each file. The manifest is getting quite large.

How I would like it to work:

Now you have to do like this:
Rules:
    wwi|rules/player.yaml
    wwi|rules/palettes.yaml
    wwi|rules/world.yaml
    wwi|rules/misc.yaml
    wwi|rules/defaults.yaml
    wwi|rules/decoration.yaml
    wwi|rules/civilian.yaml
    ...

I would like to be able to do this:
Rules:
    wwi|rules/**

Same goes for:
Rules, Sequences, TileSets, Cursors, Chrome, ChromeLayout, Weapons, Voices, Notifications, Music and Translations

data.title: You can see mines when it is laid
data.body:
It is only for one tick or so but enough for artys too shoot on them and blow up the minefield and often the minelayer with it.
You can also see them in shroud for a short moment so players sometimes see your minelayer working on a minefield wich makes it like useless.
Its the moment it is laid.

data.title: Make unit groups for  poducing buildins
data.body:
What i mean is a feature from Original Ra, when you made group 1 ( ctrl 1) for one war factory all tanks coming out of that factory was in group 1
Very nice feature because you know if you push just 1 you have selected all units produced by that building istantly.

data.title: Allow user to add a "priority unit" to production queue
data.body:
Sometimes I want to prioritze a unit in my production queue, while allready having a bunch of units in production. Currently I have to cancel all my other production, then click want I want, and then redo all the stuff I just cancelled. Much easier would be to add a unit with priority to the queue (i.e.: build it next)

Example: I suddenly need to build Tanya, But I allready have 10 rifles and 12 rocketsoldiers queued. If I could ALT-click (or something like that) then Tanya becomes priority. The single rifle infantry that is currently in production will be built, but then Tanya is next, after that production continues with the other 9 rifle + 12 rocket infantry.

Would also be nice to also be able to prioritize using shift (e.g.: prioritize 5 flack trucks before all other tanks)

data.title: Rename the Experience coloumn to Score in observer stats.
data.body: Semi-followup of #11627 for consistency.

data.title: Added the auto-generated settings documentation deployment
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11571 to finally fix https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2858.

data.title: Fix desync when removing smudges

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
The cause of the crash was that the `RemoveSmudge` method only invokes `SharedRandom` in the else-branch of an if condition that is only taken when the `RenderPlayer` has fog visibility on the location (locations the `RenderPlayer` can see get removed from `dirty` in `TickRender`).

To add insult to injury, the `Type` field does not even need to get set since [we are only using the `Sprite` field's null value as a marker to be picked up by the `TickRender` method](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/e13fa2d474a963d4148ab1db7407fb84b0f90016/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/World/SmudgeLayer.cs#L189). [The `Type` field is only ever used twice in `AddSmudge`](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/e13fa2d474a963d4148ab1db7407fb84b0f90016/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/World/SmudgeLayer.cs#L155-L159), in a branch of an if-condition [that will not be taken when the `Sprite` field is null](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/e13fa2d474a963d4148ab1db7407fb84b0f90016/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/World/SmudgeLayer.cs#L145), which we set explicitly. The same holds true for the `Depth` field.

Fixes #11660.
